messages.page_content:
- Topic: Ordinance on Zoning Regulations
- Summary: The ordinance proposed changes to zoning regulations in specific districts to allow for mixed-use development. The council voted on the ordinance, and it passed with a vote of 6 YEAS and 1 NAY.
- Ordinance Number: 0229f6ab-a0bc-417d-940a-d2aafff3030e
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 1 NAY, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed, allowing for the implementation of mixed-use development in designated districts.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Mixed-use Development, Ordinance
- UID: 0229f6ab-a0bc-417d-940a-d2aafff3030e

- Topic: Ordinance on Public Safety Funding
- Summary: This ordinance sought additional funding for public safety initiatives, including resources for law enforcement and community outreach programs. After discussion, the council voted on the ordinance, and it passed with a unanimous vote of 7 YEAS.
- Ordinance Number: 0229f6ab-a0bc-417d-940a-d2aafff3030e
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was approved, providing increased funding for public safety efforts in the city.
- Tags/Keywords: Public Safety, Funding, Law Enforcement, Community Outreach
- UID: 0229f6ab-a0bc-417d-940a-d2aafff3030e

- Topic: Recycling Bins Placement and Maintenance
- Summary: The ordinance requires the placement and maintenance of recycling bins near the store entrance, along with a litter abatement program letter approved by the Department of Sanitation. The owner/operator's contact information must be included in the letter for violation purposes.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-318
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Recycling, Litter Abatement, Sanitation, City Planning
- UID: c2d8f54e-2526-45ea-8e3f-816dbeb0ef65

- Topic: Green Roofing Installation and Sustainable Design Commitment
- Summary: This ordinance mandates the installation of green roofing as part of the fuel pump canopy, subject to approval by relevant agencies. It also requires a commitment to sustainable design and architecture, including the use of green roofs, water cistern systems, solar panels, and other energy-efficient concepts.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-318
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Green Roofing, Sustainable Design, Energy Efficiency
- UID: c2d8f54e-2526-45ea-8e3f-816dbeb0ef65

- Topic: Prohibition of Alcohol Consumption and Loitering
- Summary: This ordinance prohibits the consumption of alcoholic beverages and loitering in front of the structure or in adjacent rights-of-way.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-318
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Alcohol Prohibition, Loitering, Public Safety
- UID: c2d8f54e-2526-45ea-8e3f-816dbeb0ef65

The City Planning Commission recommended "FOR MODIFIED APPROVAL" with six (6) provisos. The council motion, M-21-315, granted the conditional use request as recommended by the Commission with modifications, including specific requirements for the car wash operation.

- Tags/Keywords: Conditional Use, Car Wash, Zoning District, City Planning Commission

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Appropriation of federal grant funds for FEMA reimbursement
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to appropriate federal grant funds from Intergovernmental Transfers to the Mayor’s Office of Homeland Security for Federal Emergency Management Agency reimbursement related costs.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,332
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed without any amendments.
- UID: cd8b8054-ca1c-4f20-9e9a-5c8871440810

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for economic development
- Summary: This ordinance authorized the Mayor of the City of New Orleans to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement between the City of New Orleans and the BioDistrict New Orleans for the purpose of using incremental increases in undedicated taxes collected within the boundaries of the District to induce economic development and other activities necessary for the enhancement of bioscience and health products.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,349
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Pending - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was pending at the time of the meeting and was continued to the next meeting.
- UID: cd8b8054-ca1c-4f20-9e9a-5c8871440810

- Topic: Legislative Grouping
- Summary: This legislative grouping involved multiple ordinances introduced by Councilmembers Brossett and Gisleson Palmer.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,351
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Pending - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The legislative grouping was pending at the time of the meeting and was continued to the next meeting.
- UID: cd8b8054-ca1c-4f20-9e9a-5c8871440810
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 8-19-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Interim Short Term Rental Fund
- Summary: This ordinance aimed to amend and clarify the status of the Interim Short Term Rental Fund, specifying its use for Short Term Rental enforcement. Additionally, an amendment was proposed to remove a specific phrase and replace it with an alternative wording.
- Ordinance Number: 33351
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 9/2/21
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to a future meeting for further discussion and potential decision.
- Tags/Keywords: Short Term Rental, Fund, Amendment, Enforcement
- UID: e8db716a-fe0c-43fa-b790-8e30e085adce

- Topic: Suspension of Monthly Sanitation Charges
- Summary: This ordinance proposed a one-time suspension of monthly sanitation charges in the City of New Orleans. The Budget Committee did not make a recommendation, and the ordinance was continued to a future meeting.
- Ordinance Number: 33393
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 9/2/21
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to a future meeting for further discussion and potential decision.
- Tags/Keywords: Sanitation Charges, Suspension, Budget Committee
- UID: e8db716a-fe0c-43fa-b790-8e30e085adce

- Topic: Appropriation of Funds from Ethics Review Board
- Summary: This ordinance aimed to amend the operating budget of the City of New Orleans for the year 2021 by appropriating funds from the Ethics Review Board Personal Services to cover credit card expenses. The ordinance was introduced by Councilmember Brossett and was continued to a future meeting.
- Ordinance Number: 33412
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 9/2/21
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to a future meeting for further discussion and potential decision.
- Tags/Keywords: Operating Budget, Appropriation, Ethics Review Board, Credit Card Expenses
- UID: e8db716a-fe0c-43fa-b790-8e30e085adce
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 8-19-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of City Code Section 154-1561 regarding designated truck routes
- Summary: The ordinance aims to remove Felicity Street as a truck route and add Martin Luther King Jr. Boulevard as a truck route. It was introduced by Councilmember Banks and passed with 6 YEAS and 1 member absent.
- Ordinance Number: 33412
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Amendment of designated truck routes in the City of New Orleans
- Tags/Keywords: City Code, truck routes, Councilmember Banks
- UID: 658be36f-5d07-4db3-8a72-2067834ea862

- Topic: Amendment of City Council Rule 10, Note B
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend City Council Rule 10, Note B, regarding the City Council's Consent Agenda and procedures. It was introduced by Councilmember Moreno and was continued to the next meeting.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-121
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Amendment of City Council Rule 10, Note B
- Tags/Keywords: City Council Rules, Consent Agenda, Councilmember Moreno
- UID: 658be36f-5d07-4db3-8a72-2067834ea862
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 8-19-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Professional Services Agreement with AH Datalytics, LLC
- Summary: Request to extend the agreement with AH Datalytics, LLC for one year and authorize up to $75,000 in compensation. Motion was continued to the meeting of 9/2/21.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-121
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Motion continued
- Decision/Key Actions: Motion was continued to the meeting of 9/2/21.
- Tags/Keywords: Professional Services Agreement, AH Datalytics, LLC, Compensation
- UID: be291086-3d3e-41a3-9ec8-0d15db946929

- Topic: Issuance of City of New Orleans Downtown Development District Limited Tax Bonds
- Summary: Resolution to approve the issuance of not exceeding $6,500,000 of City of New Orleans Downtown Development District Limited Tax Bonds. The resolution was adopted with 7 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: R-21-303
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopted - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Resolution was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: Downtown Development District, Tax Bonds, Resolution
- UID: be291086-3d3e-41a3-9ec8-0d15db946929

- Topic: Amendment to Agreement with Granicus, Inc.
- Summary: Request to extend the agreement with Granicus, Inc. Motion was continued to the meeting of 9/2/21.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-305
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Motion continued
- Decision/Key Actions: Motion was continued to the meeting of 9/2/21.
- Tags/Keywords: Agreement, Granicus, Inc., Extension
- UID: be291086-3d3e-41a3-9ec8-0d15db946929
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 8-19-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Appointment of Barksdale Hortenstine to Crisis Intervention Strategy Task Force
- Summary: The council ratified, confirmed, and approved the appointment of Barksdale Hortenstine as a member of the Crisis Intervention Strategy Task Force for a term ending on June 30, 2022.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-310
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Suspend the Rules - Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
    - Vote 2: Adopt - Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Appointment of Barksdale Hortenstine to Crisis Intervention Strategy Task Force approved.
- UID: e177bc7d-df68-445b-80dc-9eacbf44f7d6

- Topic: Extension of Term for Crisis Intervention Strategy Task Force
- Summary: The council approved the extension of the term for the Crisis Intervention Strategy Task Force for a period of one year.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-305
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Adopt - Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Extension of the term for Crisis Intervention Strategy Task Force approved.
- UID: e177bc7d-df68-445b-80dc-9eacbf44f7d6
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 8-19-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance for Tujague’s signage
- Summary: The City Planning Commission is directed to conduct a public hearing to consider amending the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to add Tujague’s signage at 823 Decatur Street and 429 Decatur Street and to Table 24-3, "Designated Classic Signs".
- Ordinance Number: M-21-311
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion passed, and the City Planning Commission is directed to conduct a public hearing for the proposed amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: City Planning Commission, Zoning Ordinance, Tujague’s signage
- UID: 3e8c1a58-7d06-4f44-8fd3-7a860a66cfed

- Topic: Amendment of Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance for "Wine Shop" conditional use
- Summary: The City Planning Commission is directed to conduct a public hearing to consider amending the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to add "Wine Shop" as a conditional use in the HMC-2 Historic Marigny/Tremé/Bywater Commercial District.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-312
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion passed, and the City Planning Commission is directed to conduct a public hearing for the proposed amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: City Planning Commission, Zoning Ordinance, Wine Shop
- UID: 3e8c1a58-7d06-4f44-8fd3-7a860a66cfed
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 8-19-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Expansion of Old Algiers Cultural District
- Summary: The council supported and endorsed the submission of an application to expand the boundaries of the state-certified Old Algiers Cultural District.
- Ordinance Number: R-21-313
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Adopt - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to support the expansion of the Old Algiers Cultural District passed unanimously.
- Tags/Keywords: Old Algiers Cultural District, expansion, Louisiana Department of Culture, Recreation, and Tourism
- UID: c1a26337-b25c-4919-8503-baf42d3d7ef0

- Topic: Introduction of Ordinances on First Reading
- Summary: The council moved to suspend the rules to introduce ordinances on first reading.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: Suspend the Rules to introduce Ordinances on First Reading - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to suspend the rules and introduce ordinances on first reading passed unanimously.
- Tags/Keywords: Ordinance introduction, first reading, council rules
- UID: c1a26337-b25c-4919-8503-baf42d3d7ef0
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 8-19-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment of City Code regarding encroachments onto City property
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend and reordain Section 146-7 and create new applications, procedures, fees, and requirements regarding encroachments onto City property. The motion passed.
- Ordinance Number: 33423
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was electronically submitted and was not postponed.
- Tags/Keywords: City Code, encroachments, fees, requirements
- UID: 1eb81ff4-5714-4742-8e86-1e708ff2a4a5

- Topic: Repeal and transfer of funds to the Department of Police
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to repeal and transfer funds from the French Quarter Improvement Fund to the Department of Police to fund a Sergeant position and purchase vehicles for patrols. The motion passed.
- Ordinance Number: 33424
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was electronically submitted and was not postponed.
- Tags/Keywords: Fund transfer, Department of Police, French Quarter Improvement Fund
- UID: 1eb81ff4-5714-4742-8e86-1e708ff2a4a5

- Topic: Authorization of lease agreements for airlines at the Louis Armstrong New Orleans International Airport
- Summary: This ordinance authorizes the Mayor of the City of New Orleans, through the New Orleans Aviation Board, to enter into lease agreements with signatory airlines operating at the airport without a solicitation and selection process. The motion passed.
- Ordinance Number: 33425
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was electronically submitted and was not postponed.
- Tags/Keywords: Lease agreements, Louis Armstrong Airport, airlines
- UID: 1eb81ff4-5714-4742-8e86-1e708ff2a4a5
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 8-19-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Safety Precautions for Tandem Floats in Carnival Parades
- Summary: An ordinance to require complete enclosure of the ends and corners of each unit of a tandem float in carnival parades, amending safety precautions. 
- Ordinance Number: 33346
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with unanimous support from the council members.
- Tags/Keywords: Safety Precautions, Tandem Floats, Carnival Parades
- UID: 82bf8632-b0e6-4554-bd6c-26a7995661fd

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with New Orleans Redevelopment Authority
- Summary: An ordinance authorizing the Mayor to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with the New Orleans Redevelopment Authority for the redevelopment of City-owned properties.
- Ordinance Number: 33427
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 1 NAY, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with majority support, with one council member voting against it.
- Tags/Keywords: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement, Redevelopment, City-owned Properties
- UID: 82bf8632-b0e6-4554-bd6c-26a7995661fd

- Topic: Lease Agreement with New Orleans Redevelopment Authority for Property
- Summary: An ordinance to authorize the Mayor to execute a lease with the New Orleans Redevelopment Authority for a property, with the rent derived through the development of affordable housing and economic development for the Public Benefit.
- Ordinance Number: 33428
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (5 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with majority support, with two council members voting against it.
- Tags/Keywords: Lease Agreement, New Orleans Redevelopment Authority, Affordable Housing, Economic Development
- UID: 82bf8632-b0e6-4554-bd6c-26a7995661fd

- Topic: Lease Agreement for Property at 2600 South Broad Street
- Summary: An ordinance to authorize the Mayor to execute a lease with the New Orleans Redevelopment Authority for the property at 2600 South Broad Street for a period of ninety-nine years, with the rent utilized for Public Benefit purposes.
- Ordinance Number: 33429
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with unanimous support from the council members.
- Tags/Keywords: Lease Agreement, New Orleans Redevelopment Authority, Property Lease, Public Benefit
- UID: 82bf8632-b0e6-4554-bd6c-26a7995661fd
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 8-19-2021

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Conditional use for retail sale of packaged alcoholic beverages at an existing gas station
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to establish a conditional use permit for the retail sale of packaged alcoholic beverages at an existing gas station in specified districts. The outcome of the vote was not provided in the summary.
- Ordinance Number: ZD NO. 40/21
- Votes Summary: Not provided
- Decision/Key Actions: Outcome of the vote not provided
- Tags/Keywords: Conditional use, alcoholic beverages, gas station, zoning
- UID: 498ad265-04dd-4d73-9b39-b6364c7a555b

- Topic: Lease agreement with the New Orleans Redevelopment Authority for property at 2314 Louisiana Avenue
- Summary: The ordinance sought to authorize the Mayor to execute a lease with the New Orleans Redevelopment Authority for the property at 2314 Louisiana Avenue. The lease would be for a period of ninety-nine years, with the rent being derived from the development of affordable housing and other public benefits. The meeting was adjourned after this ordinance was discussed.
- Ordinance Number: Not provided
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adjourned - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Meeting adjourned after discussion of this ordinance
- Tags/Keywords: Lease agreement, New Orleans Redevelopment Authority, affordable housing, economic development
- UID: 498ad265-04dd-4d73-9b39-b6364c7a555b
